comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I haven't tried, but my suspicion is that you could take them through the griddle-baking step and then freeze them, then thaw and do the pan-frying when you want to serve. If you give it a go, let us know the results!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I haven't tried, but my suspicion is that you could freeze them after the griddle-baking step, then defrost and pan-fry for service. If you give it a go, let us know how it works out!

comments.author: Tamara Sellman
comments.content:
Thanks, Michael, I'll definitely give it a go, it makes sense to freeze after griddling but before frying. Could be a new quick snack option in a household of busy parents and teenagers, thanks!

comments.author: Dana S.
comments.content: Button mushrooms have fallen out of favor so much lately that I was surprised to see you use them.  Any particular reason for that particular variety?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I think they are underrated; they taste great as long as you cook them enough to develop flavor. That said, this would be terrific with shiitakes as well.
